template.description: A complete workflow that pulls a single NOAA HCN weather file via FTP, parses it into Json objects representing a weather reading for a single day, then inserts into Couchbase.
template.name: NOAA_to_Couchbase

value.description: The hostnames or ip addresses of the bootstraping nodes and optional parameters. Syntax) couchbase://node1,node2,nodeN?param1=value1&param2=value2&paramN=valueN
value.name: Connection String

value.description: A Couchbase Cluster Controller Service which manages connections to a Couchbase cluster.
value.name: Couchbase Cluster Controller Service

value.description: The name of bucket to access.
value.name: Bucket Name

value.description: The type of contents.
value.name: Document Type

value.description: A static, fixed Couchbase document id.Or an expression to construct the Couchbase document id.
value.name: Document Id

value.description: Durability constraint about disk persistence.
value.name: Persist To

value.description: Durability constraint about replication.
value.name: Replicate To

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the remote system
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The port that the remote system is listening on for file transfers
value.name: Port

value.description: Username
value.name: Username

value.description: Password for the user account
value.name: Password

value.description: The FTP Connection Mode
value.name: Connection Mode

value.description: The FTP Transfer Mode
value.name: Transfer Mode

value.description: The path on the remote system from which to pull or push files
value.name: Remote Path

value.description: Provides a Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied, only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched
value.name: File Filter Regex

value.description: When Search Recursively is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given Regular Expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter Regex

value.description: Determines how long to wait between fetching the listing for new files
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: If true, will pull files from arbitrarily nested subdirectories; otherwise, will not traverse subdirectories
value.name: Search Recursively

value.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored
value.name: Ignore Dotted Files

value.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred
value.name: Delete Original

value.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while transferring data
value.name: Data Timeout

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection
value.name: Max Selects

value.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical. Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.
value.name: Remote Poll Batch Size

value.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined
value.name: Use Natural Ordering

value.description: Proxy type used for file transfers
value.name: Proxy Type

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: Http Proxy Username
value.name: Http Proxy Username

value.description: Http Proxy Password
value.name: Http Proxy Password

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Regular Expression to search for in the FlowFile content
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to replace the regular expression with. Back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value.
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Evaluate the 'Regular Expression' against each line (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and then evaluate the 'Regular Expression'.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

processors.name: Format day files into json objects

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully updated are routed to this relationship, as well as FlowFiles whose content does not match the given Regular Expression
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

processors.name: Get Json data for flowfile attributes

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file
value.name: Line Split Count

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

processors.name: Break day lines into single day files

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits

value.description: The Regular Expression to search for in the FlowFile content
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to replace the regular expression with. Back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value.
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Evaluate the 'Regular Expression' against each line (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and then evaluate the 'Regular Expression'.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

processors.name: Expand month lines into single day lines

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully updated are routed to this relationship, as well as FlowFiles whose content does not match the given Regular Expression
relationships.name: success

value.description: A Couchbase Cluster Controller Service which manages connections to a Couchbase cluster.
value.name: Couchbase Cluster Controller Service

value.description: The name of bucket to access.
value.name: Bucket Name

value.description: The type of contents.
value.name: Document Type

value.description: A static, fixed Couchbase document id.Or an expression to construct the Couchbase document id.
value.name: Document Id

value.description: Durability constraint about disk persistence.
value.name: Persist To

value.description: Durability constraint about replication.
value.name: Replicate To

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that cannot written to Couchbase Server and can't be retried are routed to this relationship.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that cannot written to Couchbase Server but can be retried are routed to this relationship.
relationships.name: retry

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Couchbase Server are routed to this relationship.
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file
value.name: Line Split Count

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

processors.name: Break File into single line files

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits

value.description: Indicates the criteria that is used to control the throughput rate. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Control Criteria

value.description: The maximum rate at which data should pass through this processor. The format of this property is expected to be a positive integer, or a Data Size (such as '1 MB') if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'data rate'.
value.name: Maximum Rate

value.description: The name of an attribute whose values build toward the rate limit if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'attribute value'. The value of the attribute referenced by this property must be a positive long, or the FlowFile will be routed to failure. This value is ignored if Rate Control Criteria is not set to 'attribute value'. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Controlled Attribute

value.description: The amount of time to which the Maximum Data Size and Maximum Number of Files pertains. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Time Duration

value.description: By default, a single "throttle" is used for all FlowFiles. If this value is specified, a separate throttle is used for each value specified by the attribute with this name. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Grouping Attribute

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success
